summary: Dire Straits was a popular British rock band formed in 1977. The original members were Mark and David Knopfler, John Illsley, and Pick Withers. They created a unique sound, blending country, folk, and blues. Their debut album's single, "Sultans of Swing," became a huge hit in the UK and US. The band released many successful songs and albums, with "Brothers in Arms" being their biggest seller. They won numerous awards and sold over 100 million records worldwide. Dire Straits broke up in 1995, and Mark Knopfler, the main songwriter, continues his solo career.
title: Dire Straits
